title: Oakland police are doubling down on a tough-on-crime plan. Some activists are skeptical
dc:creator: Gregory Yee
description: Oakland Police Chief LeRonne Armstrong is extending a plan that he says has tamped down violent crime, but for some activists the strategy is a return to failed policies of the past.
content:encoded: Oakland Police Chief LeRonne Armstrong is extending a plan that he says has tamped down violent crime, but for some activists the strategy is a return to failed policies of the past.

media:content.media:description: OAKLAND, CALIFORNIA - DECEMBER 27: Oakland Police Chief LeRonne Armstrong takes questions from the media during a press conference at police headquarters in downtown Oakland, Calif., on Monday, Dec. 27, 2021. The chief addressed multiple incidents of violence over the Christmas holiday weekend, including a homicide, an officer-involved shooting, armed carjackings and other shootings. (Jane Tyska/Digital First Media/East Bay Times via Getty Images)
